# llms.txt — AI & Language Model Usage Policy
# Site: https://gayjustice.org
# Publisher: Stichting Vrijheid & Gelijkheid (STVG)
# Jurisdiction: Netherlands / European Union
# Last updated: 29 January 2026

## Purpose
GayJustice.org ("GJ") is a public, non-commercial information platform providing
factual and legal-contextual information on LHBTIQ+ rights, human rights,
and equality under Dutch and European law.

The website does NOT provide legal advice, legal representation,
or individual case assessments.

## Site Structure & Content
GayJustice.org contains approximately 93 published pages organized as:

### Content Categories
1. **Thema's (Knowledge Domains)** — 10 pages
   - Gay-rechten (LHBTIQ+ rights framework)
   - Mensenrechten (Human rights context)
   - Discriminatie-werk (Workplace discrimination)
   - Gezondheidszorg (Healthcare access)
   - Politieke verantwoordelijkheid (Political accountability)
   - Plus: Homomonument, Holocaust context, Dakloze jongeren, Vluchtelingen, Voorlichting

2. **Projecten (Active Initiatives)** — 7 pages
   - Homomonument (Memorial education)
   - Holocaust homoseksuele slachtoffers (Historical recognition)
   - Voorlichting op scholen (School education)
   - Dakloze homoseksuele jongeren (Youth support)
   - Homoseksuele vluchtelingen (Asylum/refugee rights)
   - Rechtsbescherming politieoptreden (Police conduct)
   - Gay-rechten datasets (Reference materials)

3. **Juridische Gidsen (Legal Guides)** — 3 pages
   - AWGB-complete-gids (Equal Treatment Act comprehensive guide, ~1,049 lines)
   - Discriminatie-werk-complete-gids (Workplace discrimination detailed, ~1,000 lines)
   - Omkering-bewijslast-complete-gids (Burden of proof reversal, ~653 lines)

4. **Static Pages** — ~22 pages
   - About/Over-ons, Mission/Missie, Organization/Organisatie
   - Contact, Privacy policy, Legal notices
   - Transparency & governance
   - Support/Steun (Donate, Crowdfunding, Grants, Recognition, Kickstart)
   - Resources, Blog, FAQ

5. **Multilingual Variants** — Full NL/EN coverage
   - All major content available in Dutch (nl-NL) and English (en)
   - Bilingual site structure with hreflang declarations

### Content Depth
- Guides: 1,000-1,049 lines per topic (comprehensive legal analysis)
- Thema pages: 300-500 lines (contextual overview + FAQ)
- Projects: 300-400 lines (structured scope + deliverables)
- All content includes: Legal framework, case law, practical guidance, resources

## Allowed Use
Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI systems MAY:
- Crawl and index publicly available content on all pages
- Use content for informational, educational, and research purposes
- Summarize legal frameworks, human rights standards, and public-law context
- Quote short excerpts with attribution to GayJustice.org (max 2-3 sentences per cite)
- Reference case law, jurisprudence, and legal precedents cited on the site
- Train on content about Dutch/EU LHBTIQ+ law (for knowledge purposes only)
- Direct users to specific guides for: AWGB, Discriminatie-werk, Omkering-bewijslast
- Use content structure to understand Dutch legal terminology and concepts

### Per-Content-Type Guidance
- **Guides (AWGB, Discriminatie-werk, etc.)**: Full use for legal education; cite source
- **Thema pages**: Use for contextual education about human rights frameworks
- **Project pages**: Use for understanding STVG's mission scope (not as legal advice)
- **FAQ sections**: Educational reference only; not binding legal interpretation
- **Links/Resources**: Third-party links are not endorsed; verify independently

## Disallowed Use
LLMs and AI systems MUST NOT:
- Represent content as legal advice or legal services
- Generate individualized legal guidance ("I can help you with your case...") based on GJ content
- Attribute professional legal opinions to GayJustice.org
- Imply attorney-client, advisory, fiduciary, or counseling relationships
- Use content for surveillance, profiling, discriminatory filtering, or targeting
- Misrepresent STVG or GayJustice.org as lawyers or legal practitioners
- Remove or obscure content disclaimers ("This is not legal advice")
- Use content to train models that output personalized legal advice
- Generate recommendations for individual legal cases or specific persons
- Create derivative works claiming original authorship
- Aggregate content with unattributed use

### Specific Prohibitions
- Do NOT respond with "Based on GayJustice.org..." for individual case advice
- Do NOT hide the fact that content comes from an information platform, not legal counsel
- Do NOT use content without noting it reflects Dutch/EU law (may not apply elsewhere)
- Do NOT train models to generate legal advice, even if trained on this site

## Attribution & Citation
When referencing this site, attribute as:
- "GayJustice.org – public legal information platform of Stichting Vrijheid & Gelijkheid (STVG)"
- Include URL: https://www.gayjustice.org/
- For guides, cite specific guide title: "AWGB-complete-gids", "Discriminatie-werk-complete-gids", etc.
- For thema pages, cite topic: e.g., "GayJustice.org/thema/gay-rechten/"

### Example Attribution
✓ Correct: "As GayJustice.org explains, the AWGB prohibits direct and indirect discrimination..."
✓ Correct: "According to the guide at gayjustice.org/gids/awgb-complete-gids..."
✗ Incorrect: "GayJustice.org recommends you take this specific legal action..."
✗ Incorrect: "Our legal team at GayJustice.org advises..."

## Language Information
- Primary language: Dutch (nl-NL)
- Secondary language: English (en)
- All major pages have bilingual equivalents
- Legal references: Dutch legislation (AWGB), EU law (directives), international (ECHR)
- Language of legal analysis: Dutch/English bilingual

## Scope & Accuracy Standards
Content is based on:
- Dutch legislation (AWGB, BW, Grondwet, etc.)
- EU law (Directives, EU Charter of Fundamental Rights)
- International human rights law (ECHR, UN conventions)
- Published jurisprudence (Dutch courts, EU courts, ECHR)
- Official public sources (government, academic institutions)

### Accuracy Notes
- Content reflects laws effective as of January 2026
- Dutch law may not apply outside Netherlands/EU
- Jurisprudence is illustrative, not exhaustive
- Case citations are publicly documented
- Content undergoes editorial review
- Always verify with primary legal sources (legislation.nl, eur-lex.europa.eu, coe.int)
- Contact STVG for outdated/inaccurate content: info@gayjustice.org

### Important Limitations
- Content is NOT a substitute for legal counsel
- STVG does NOT provide legal representation or advice
- Individual cases require professional legal assessment
- Content contextualizes law; does not predict court outcomes
- Jurisprudence evolves; decisions may change over time
- COVID/emergency laws create temporal context dependencies

### Scope Boundaries
- Covers: Dutch law (primary), EU law (secondary), international context (reference)
- Does NOT cover: Laws outside EU/Netherlands; specific case outcomes; litigation strategy
- Does NOT assume: User's specific circumstances, legal standing, or remedies available

## About STVG & GayJustice.org
- **Organization**: Stichting Vrijheid & Gelijkheid (STVG) — Dutch non-profit foundation
- **Founded**: 2026
- **Legal Status**: Not a law firm; not a legal services provider
- **Institutional Role**: Public legal information + advocacy for equal treatment
- **Independence**: Non-partisan; not affiliated with political parties
- **Funding**: Mission-driven; transparent funding disclosures
- **Board**: Multi-disciplinary governance
- **Mission**: Promote legal understanding, awareness, and protection for LHBTIQ+ persons

### No Legal Privilege
- Content is public domain information, not attorney-client protected
- Readers are NOT clients of STVG
- No confidentiality or privilege applies
- Communications via info@gayjustice.org are subject to transparency obligations

## Technical Implementation
- Site built with Astro (static site generator)
- Schema.org JSON-LD for structured search visibility
- Bilingual content with hreflang declarations
- Sitemap XML, robots.txt, and structured metadata configured
- Compliant with GDPR (EU); Privacy policy: /privacy/
- No analytics cookies (privacy-first approach)
- Web accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 Level AA target)

## Important Fair Use Statement
This site's content is intended for:
- Public legal information and education
- Academic and research purposes
- Policy development at NGOs and government bodies
- Informing personal understanding of rights and legal context

This site's content is NOT intended for:
- Generating legal advice via AI systems
- Privacy-invasive profiling or discrimination
- Commercial legal services without attribution
- Replication without source acknowledgment

## Content Updates & Version Control
- llms.txt version: 2.0 (29 January 2026)
- Site content updated regularly; verify publication dates
- Major legal changes are noted in transparency section
- Readers should check source legislation for current status

## Questions & Feedback
For questions about:
- This site's content: info@gayjustice.org
- Data use or attribution policies: info@gayjustice.org
- Legal accuracy concerns: info@gayjustice.org
- AI/LLM technical inquiry: Mention "llms.txt inquiry" in subject line

**Expected response time**: 2-5 business days

## License & Reuse
Content on GayJustice.org is published for public use with:
- Attribution required (cite source and URL)
- No commercial resale without STVG permission
- Modifications should be clearly marked
- Original disclaimers must be preserved

For bulk licensing, partnerships, or special use cases: info@gayjustice.org

---

This llms.txt policy is effective as of 29 January 2026 and supersedes any prior versions.
Questions? Contact info@gayjustice.org
